The answer has two verses.
The first verse says that because the essence of time does not exist, the characteristics do not exist.
The second verse says that because the characteristics do not exist, time does not exist.
The first half clarifies that time has no essence.
The second half clarifies that because the essence does not exist, the characteristics do not exist.
If the past still abides, it is the present.
It is not called the past.
If the past does not abide, it loses its own characteristics.
Losing its own characteristics means there is no essence of time.
Then there is no past.
It is the same as the Ba lun, which says that the past of the past is not called the past.
The future is also like this.
If the future has not yet come, it is non-existent.
If it is non-existent, there is no time.
If the future already exists, it is the present.
There is also no future.
The first two gates accuse the past of non-existence.
Since the past does not exist, the other two times also do not exist.
The two gates accuse the future of non-existence.
Since the future does not exist, the other two times also do not exist.
Moreover, if the substance of time abides, it is always a single thought without years and months.
Since there are no years and months, there is also no single thought.
If time does not abide, then each thought perishes and there is no continuity.
How can there be years and months?
You originally accumulate time to form days.
You accumulate days to form months.
You accumulate months to form years.
If one day perishes, then there is later without earlier.
How can you accumulate days to form months?
If days do not perish, then there is only one day with earlier without later.
How can you further accumulate days to form months?
Therefore, abiding and not abiding are both impossible.
Another interpretation says:

Moreover, it is asked: If time is permanent,
permanence has no three times.
If time is impermanent,
moment by moment arising and ceasing, it also has no three times.
Moreover, it is said:
In the first moment of ignorance, before the four abodes of consciousness have arisen, it is called the beginning.
Since there is no later, how can there be a beginning?
If without the later it is called the beginning,
it can also be called the later.
Moreover, if without the later it is called the beginning, then the beginning is naturally so.
Moreover, if without the later there is a beginning, then without the beginning there should be a later.
The first half of the second verse clarifies that time exists due to things.
Then things are the essence of time.
The second half clarifies that since things do not exist, time does not exist.
It is like knowing the time of spring and autumn due to things such as flowers and fruits.
The flowers, fruits, and so forth have been refuted in various ways above, so they do not exist.
Since there are no things, time does not exist either.
